definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: EB members readily agreed that more authority should be delegated to country offices.
sentences.chinese: 執委們爽快同意應向國家辦事處進一步放權。

sentences.english: Increased delegation of authority goes together with a demand for increased transparency and accountability.
sentences.chinese: 在進一步放權的同時，需要提高透明度和增強問責制。

sentences.english: The government has also streamlined its administration and delegated authority, and innovated and improved government approval services.
sentences.chinese: 不斷推進簡政放權，創新優化行政審批服務方式。

sentences.english: China started its reforms with the devolution of central power, especially regional decentralization.
sentences.chinese: 中國的經濟改革始於放權，尤其是對地區的放權。

sentences.english: China started its reforms with the devolution of central power, especially regional decentralization.
sentences.chinese: 中國的經濟改革始於放權，尤其是對地區的放權。

definition: to join an alliance/admission to the United Nations
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
